snippet: A spending bill for 2014 would end the worst of the sequester cuts.
abstract: Editorial welcomes $1 trillion appropriations bill that emerged from Congress, barring possible attempts by hard-right members of the House to block it; contends bill means some important domestic programs will finally get much of the money they need; notes bill still has a smaller spending amount than what is needed for necessary investments in education and infrastructure.
lead_paragraph: A spending bill for 2014 would end the worst of the sequester cuts.
